org.integratedmodelling.thinklab.api.modelling
Interface IExtent

All Superinterfaces:
IConceptualizable, IIndirectObservation, IInstanceImplementation, IMetadataHolder, IObservation, IState, ITopologicallyComparable
public interface IExtent
extends IState, ITopologicallyComparable

An Extent describes the topology of the observable it's linked to. Conceptual models are capable of producing unions or intersections of extents. Extents must be conceptualizable and the result of conceptualizing them must be an observation describing the extent.

Author:
Ferdinando Villa

isCovered

boolean isCovered(int granule)
True if the i-th granule correspond to a concrete subdivision where things can be observed. Determines the status of data or no-data for any state defined over this extent.

getDatasourceTransformation

IDataSource.Transformation getDatasourceTransformation(IConcept mainObservable,
                                                       IExtent extent)
                                                       throws ThinklabException
Return the transformation, if any, that will be necessary to operate on a datasource that conforms to us so that it matches the passed extent.

Parameters:
mainObservable - the observable for the main observation that owns the extent (what the states mean)
extent - the extent we must adapt the datasource to
Returns:
a transformation to be passed to the datasource
Throws:
ThinklabException

getSignature

java.lang.String getSignature()
Create a string signature that has no spaces, represents the extent accurately, and is the same for extents that are equal. Used to cache data across runs and within runs of the same model.

Returns:

getStateLocators

java.util.Collection<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer>> getStateLocators(int index)
Return a list of location references to use in expressions and their relative offsets in the dimension described by this extent. For example, a time grid extent will return "previous, -1" so that the previous state can be referenced in expressions (with syntax dependent on the language: e.g. in the Clojure accessor, for state "altitude", the var will be :altitude/previous). Space grids should return things like n,s,e,w, etc. with offsets determined by the specific configuration. The list of locators depends on the specific location, so the overall index in the dimension is passed. If no locators can be defined, a null should be returned.

Returns:

checkDomainDiscontinuity

boolean checkDomainDiscontinuity()
                                 throws ThinklabException
Should return whether the coverage of the domain is discontinuous to the point of breaking the internal rules of the represented topologies. E.g., if we represent continuous uninterrupted space, discontinuities will break neighborhood relationships that models may need to count on. This may come as a result of intersecting partial extents.

Returns:
Throws:
ThinklabException

intersection

IExtent intersection(IExtent extent)
                     throws ThinklabException
Return an extent which represents the intersection of this with the passed one. NOTE: it is expected that the intersected extent can be index-remapped to a sub-extent of this. Meaning that subdivisions etc. need to be in sync.

Parameters:
myExtent -
Returns:
Throws:
ThinklabException

union

IExtent union(IExtent extent)
              throws ThinklabException
Return an extent which represents the union of this with the passed one. Same note as intersect(): the union extent must be usable together with this through an index remap operation.

Parameters:
myExtent -
Returns:
Throws:
ThinklabException

force

IExtent force(IExtent extent)
              throws ThinklabException
Return an extent that is capable of representing the passed one exactly. If the passed one is of the same class, it can just return the passed one, but it's provided to give the extent a chance of adjustments or of raising errors.

Parameters:
extent -
Returns:
Throws:
ThinklabException

getAggregationParameters

IExtent.AggregationParameters getAggregationParameters(IConcept concept,
                                                       IUnit unit)
                                                       throws ThinklabException
Return a descriptor of how aggregation should be performed in this extent for a value of the passed type. If a unit is associated, it must be capable of creating the unit of the aggregated concept, which will eliminate the dimension we represent if the concept is an extensive one.

Parameters:
concept -
unit -
Returns:
Throws:
ThinklabException
